name: calc set point display
rounding
func:
msg.payload = parseFloat((msg.payload / 100).toFixed(1));
return msg;

name: Coil Power
func:
var status = global.get("coil_status")/100

var p1 = 7.84e3
var p2 = 9.346e-15
var q1 = 2/3
q = msg.payload*0.277778
msg.payload = (((p1*q+p2)/(q+q1))*2)*status;
return msg;

name: Return Water Temp
func:
var p = msg.payload
var q = global.get("Flow")*0.00028; //water Flow, assumed to be constant
var Tw_s = flow.get("Tw_s") || 10;
var Ts = flow.get("Ts") || 2;
var Tw_r = flow.get("Tw_r") || 10;
var rho = 997
var V = 0.09  // m3, volume of water 
var M = V*rho  // Mass of water volumne
var c = 4182  // water heat storage capacity
var C = M*c  // Thermal Capacity of Coil

var dot_T = (-q*rho*c*(Tw_r-Tw_s)+p)/C

var T = Tw_r+dot_T*Ts

flow.set("Tw_r",T)
msg.Tw_r = T
msg.payload = parseFloat(T).toFixed(2);
msg.topic = "water"
return msg;

name: Supply Air Temp
load calc
Sensor To Global
Header Logo (and clock)
format:
<script id="clockScript1" type="text/javascript">
    var clockInterval;
    $(function () {
        if (clockInterval) return;

        //add logo
        var div1 = $('<div/>');
        var logo = new Image();

        logo.src = '/logo_old.png'
        logo.height = 45;
        div1[0].style.margin = '5px';

        div1.append(logo);

        //add clock
        var div2 = $('<div/>');
        var p = $('<p/>');

        div2.append(p);
        div2[0].style.margin = '10px auto';
        
        var div3 = $('<div/>');
        div3[0].style.margin = '10px auto';
        function displayTime() {
            p.text(new Date().toLocaleString());
        }
        
        clockInterval = setInterval(displayTime, 1000);

        //add to toolbar when it's available
        var addToToolbarTimer;
        
        function addToToolbar() {
            var toolbar = $('.md-toolbar-tools');
            
            if(!toolbar.length) return;
            
            toolbar.append(div3);
            toolbar.append(div1);
            clearInterval(addToToolbarTimer);
        }
        addToToolbarTimer = setInterval(addToToolbar, 100);
    });
</script>

name: 200 range split
func:
var msg1 ={'payload' : {'data' : msg.payload.data[0],'buffer': []}}//200 Status
msg1.payload.buffer[0] = msg.payload.buffer[0]//Status
msg1.payload.buffer[1] = msg.payload.buffer[1]//Status

var msg2 ={'payload' : {'data' : []}} // 201 Process Feedback
msg2.payload.data[0] = msg.payload.data[1]

var msg3 ={'payload' : {'data' : []}} //202 Control mode
msg3.payload.data[0] = msg.payload.data[2]

var msg4 ={'payload' : {'data' : []}} //203 Operation Mode
msg4.payload.data[0] = msg.payload.data[3]

var msg5 ={'payload' : {'data' : []}} //204 Fault Code
msg5.payload.data[0] = msg.payload.data[4]

var msg6 ={'payload' : {'data' : []}} //205 Alarm Code
msg6.payload.data[0] = msg.payload.data[5]

var msg7 ={'payload' : {'data' : []}} //206 Bearing Status
msg7.payload.data[0] = msg.payload.data[6]

var msg8 ={'payload' : {'data' : []}} //207 Drive State
msg8.payload.data[0] = msg.payload.data[7]

var msg9 ={'payload' : {'data' : []}} // Sensor Feedback
msg9.payload.data[0] = msg.payload.data[8]//208 FeedbackSensorUnit
msg9.payload.data[1] = msg.payload.data[9]//209 FeedbackSensorMin
msg9.payload.data[2] = msg.payload.data[10] //210 FeedbackSensorMax


var msg12 ={'payload' : {'data' : []}} //Freq info
msg12.payload.data[0] = msg.payload.data[11] //211NomFrequency
msg12.payload.data[1] = msg.payload.data[12]//212 MinFrequency
msg12.payload.data[2] = msg.payload.data[13]//213 MaxFrequency

var msg15 ={'payload' : {'data' : []}} 
msg15.payload.data[0] = msg.payload.data[14]//214 SetpointRangeMin
msg15.payload.data[1] = msg.payload.data[15]//215 SetpointRangeMax

var msg16 ={'payload' : {'data' : []}} 
msg16.payload.data[0] = msg.payload.data[21]//222 Kp
msg16.payload.data[1] = msg.payload.data[22]//223 Ti
msg16.payload.data[2] = msg.payload.data[23]//224 DirectControl
return [msg1,msg2,msg3,msg4,msg5,msg6,msg7,msg8,msg9,msg12,msg15,msg16];

rational fit
func:
var q = global.get("Flow");
var q_max = 4.6

var p1 = 8594
var p2 = 4.258
var q1 = 6451
var q2 = 2322
var Q = 52000
//var Q = 31500
var x = q/q_max

f = (p1*x+p2)/(x^2+q1*x+q2)
msg.payload = f*Q

return msg;

name: Format Data
Format HTML
template:
<canvas id="bubble-chart" width="90%" height="90%" margin="auto"></canvas>

<script>
new Chart(document.getElementById("bubble-chart"), {
    type: 'scatter',
    data: {
      labels: "label",
      datasets: [
        {
          label: "{{{payload.legend1}}}",
          backgroundColor: "rgba(65, 72, 255, 1.0000)",
          borderColor: "#000",
          fill: false,
          showLine: false,
          data: [
            {{{payload.data1}}}

          ]
        }
      ]
    },
    options: {
        animation: false,
        legend: {
            display: false,
            labels: {
                fontColor: 'rgb(255, 255, 255)'
            }
        },
    title: {
        display: false,
        text: '{{{payload.title}}}',
        fontColor: 'rgb(255, 255, 255)'
      },
      scales: {
        yAxes: [{
          ticks: {
            beginAtZero:true,
            fontColor: 'rgb(255, 255, 255,0.5)',
            suggestedMax: 6,
          },
          gridLines: {
            display: true,
            drawBorder: true,
            color: 'rgb(255, 255, 255,0.1)',
        },
          scaleLabel: {
            display: true,
            labelString: "Head [m]",
            fontColor: 'rgb(255, 255, 255)',
            
          },
         
        }],
        xAxes: [{ 
          ticks: {
            beginAtZero:true,
            fontColor: 'rgb(255, 255, 255,0.5)',
            suggestedMax: 5,
          },
          gridLines: {
            display: true,
            drawBorder: true,
            color: 'rgb(255, 255, 255,0.1)',
        },
          scaleLabel: {
            display: true,
            labelString: "Flow [m\u00B3/h]",
            fontColor: 'rgb(255, 255, 255)',
            
          }
        }]
      }
    }
});

</script>

Grundfos Distributed Pumping Temperature Control Demo

The purpose of this demo is to showcase the MAGNA3 capabilities within temperature control and other features. For this purpose, simplified thermodynamic equations are implemented in the Dedicated Control Unit (DCU), to simulate the temperature response of a coil supplied by chilled water. The coil is assumed to be ideal performance, meaning that the coil characteristic follows the prescribed curve with no deviations.

The demo offers two different control options, a DPS coil pump mode and a PICV mode. The following sections will explain the difference between these two modes. The flow meter reading is used as an input for the Coil Power output curve for both modes.

DPS Coil Pump Mode

In this mode, the pump the controller is passing the simulated Supply Air Temperature (SAT) to the as an analog signal in the 0-10V range.

The pump is using its Constant Temperature Control mode, which automatically adjusts the speed of the pump, and thereby the flow in the system, according to the load in the simulation and the setpoint defined via the Dashboard. It is possible to change the Controller parameters, Kp and Ti which are respectively the Proportional- and Integrator constants. This will affect the pumps response and serve to showcase and educate the impact of tuning the Controller in the pump

PICV Mode

In this mode, the flow is controlled via a PICV valve which lift-percentage is controlled by DCU which is using a PI-controller to maintain the SUT at the defined Setpoint.

In this mode, the pump is serving as a pressure source, and operates in Constant Head Control mode. This is representative of ASHRAEs recommendation of maintaining a constant differential pressure across the Index branch, as the pump head in this small closed-loop demo is equal to the differential pressure across the whole demo loop.
It is possible to configure the travel speed of the PICV, but as default it is set to 24 sec/mm which is the factory default speed of this particular PICV.

template:
How to use this dashboard

  1. Select either the pump or PICV mode
  2. Occupancy can be changed on the fly, to change the load on the system
  3. When ready, press start and the simulation will begin and you can follow the progress on the different plots
  4. If you which to stop or restart the simulation, press the Reset
  5. You can toggle the view of the Pump Status view by clicking this button
